intro: Hedyotis capillipes, commonly known as the small-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, wiry stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Hedyotis capillipes thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
